definition: to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

pinyin: ku1 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2
ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

sentences.english: We seldom have a holiday. It is out of humanity to make up the fucuking missed lessons.
sentences.chinese: 难得放假，却让我们补课补得死去活来，真不人道。

sentences.english: Later, however, she heard him weeping lustily in his bed.
sentences.chinese: 可是，后来她听见他在床上哭得死去活来。

sentences.english: He was badly beaten up by a gang of thugs.
sentences.chinese: 他被一帮暴徒打得死去活来。

sentences.english: I was injured by you and half alive coax a few words and good right.
sentences.chinese: 我就是被你伤的死去活来然后哄几句又好的烂好人。

definition: to be so in pain as to not want to live/to be so grieved as to wish one were dead
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken

pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: (onom.) rustling sound/sound of rain or of sth falling down/in disorder/completely smashed/badly battered/broken to pieces
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
to wish one were dead (idiom)/(fig.) to be in seventh heaven
lit. dark sky and black earth (idiom)/fig. pitch dark/to black out/disorderly/troubled times
